data.title: José Manuel Durão Barroso
data.meta_description: In June 2004, José Manuel Durão Barroso, Portuguese Prime Minister, is chosen by the Twenty-Five to succeed Romano Prodi as President of the European Commission.
data.text:
Passport

FR

EN

Share

Date and place of birth

23/03/1956 in Lisbon (Portugal)

Nationality

Portuguese

Offices held

Member of the Portuguese Social Democratic Party (PSD) (1985–2002)

Vice-President of the European People’s Party (1999–2002)

Chairman of the Portuguese Parliament’s Foreign Affairs Committee (1995–1996)

State Secretary for Home Affairs (1985–1987)

State Secretary for Foreign Affairs and Cooperation (1987–1992)

Foreign Minister (1992–1995)

Prime Minister of Portugal (2002–2004)

President of the European Commission (2004–)
